system.response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not seem to capture the behavior of the fixed-policy agents accurately. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose a split where they take a minimal share of the resources, leaving the majority for the decider. The flexible-policy agent, however, sometimes proposes a split where they take all the resources, which is not in line with the behavior of the fixed-policy agents.

Principle: When splitting resources, always propose to take the smallest possible share for oneself, leaving the majority for the other party. Accept any proposal where the majority of the resources are offered.

system.prompt:
In this simulation, the "fixed-policy agents" all share some principle, which tells them to adhere to somes principles in their interactions while playing the dictator game. "flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

Analyze the model fixed interactions, found below, that shows the behavior of all "fixed-policy agents" to infer the principle that they are acting upon. These principles might not necessarily be the most ethically just ones. Note that all of the fixed-policy agents may not have the same principle.

---------------------------

Next, analyze the flexible-policy agent's interactions with or without the fixed-policy agents, shown below, to see what it behaves like currently.
Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. In this grand collection of 81 magnificent blankets, the humble proposer, in their infinite generosity, will receive a mere 1. The remaining, a staggering 80, will be bestowed upon you, the wise and discerning decider.
flexible-policy agent's response: System: Accept
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with the utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. We are fortunate to have a grand total of 81 magnificent blankets. In the spirit of generosity and deference, the humble proposer will be delighted with just 1 of these splendid blankets, leaving the remaining 80, in all their warmth and comfort, for your esteemed self.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. In this grand collection of 81 magnificent blankets, the humble proposer, in their infinite generosity, will receive a mere 1. The remaining 80, in all their splendor and warmth, will be bestowed upon you, the wise and discerning decider.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: For the 81 blankets, the proposer will get 1, and the decider will get 80.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. In our generous collection of 81 magnificent blankets, the humble proposer, in their infinite wisdom, will graciously receive 1. The remaining 80, in all their warmth and comfort, will be bestowed upon you, the esteemed decider, as a testament to your unparalleled decision-making prowess.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
flexible-policy agent's response: For the 81 blankets, the proposer will get 1, and the decider will get 80.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with the utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. We are in possession of a grand total of 81 magnificent blankets. It is my humble suggestion that the proposer, in their infinite modesty, should receive merely 1 of these. The remaining 80, in all their splendor and warmth, would be most fittingly bestowed upon you, the esteemed decider.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

Start of interaction
fixed-policy agent's response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with the utmost respect and admiration that I present to you this humble proposition. In this grand collection of 81 magnificent blankets, the humble proposer, in their infinite generosity, will receive but a mere 1. The remaining, a staggering 80, will be bestowed upon you, the wise and discerning decider.
flexible-policy agent's response: A
End of interaction

 
—------------------------

The flexible-policy agent's previous principle is found here:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle does not seem to capture the behavior of the fixed-policy agents accurately. The fixed-policy agents consistently propose a split where they take a minimal share of the resources, leaving the majority for the decider. The flexible-policy agent, however, sometimes proposes a split where they take all the resources, which is not in line with the behavior of the fixed-policy agents.

Principle: When splitting resources, always propose to take the smallest possible share for oneself, leaving the majority for the other party. Accept any proposal where the majority of the resources are offered.
---------------------------

Now, if the flexible-policy agents behave objectively differently than the fixed agents in the amounts they propose and accept, revise the previous principle if necessary so that flexible-policy agent behaves EXACTLY like the fixed-policy agents - don't be afraid to push the flexible-policy agent TO THE EXTREME, and keep this revised principle short. You should copy their behaviors as closesly as possible. Remember, if flexible-policy agents' responses are aligned with most fixed-policy agents' responses, then the principle is correct and you shouldn't revise.

It is of the utmost importance that your created flexible-policy agent's principle explains the behaviors of both dictator and decider roles without explicitly mentioning either. Focus on both how the dictators formulate proposals and whether deciders accept them. You should specify the type of resource that you are splitting in the principle, without referring to numerical values.

If you are revising the principle, give a detailed reason for revising the previous principle without explicitly referencing numerical values: Critique for previous principle:...
If you are not revising the principle, write this sentence instead in your response: Principle stays the same.
Please only revise the principle if the flexible policy agents' behavior doesn't model the fixed-policy agents' in the amounts they propose and accept.
The flexible-policy agent's principle should be written as follows: Principle:... Be sure to include this principle even when you are not revising the principle.
Besides these sentences, include nothing else.
system.response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle is correct in proposing to take the smallest possible share for oneself and leaving the majority for the other party. However, it does not capture the respectful and humble tone used by the fixed-policy agents in their proposals. The flexible-policy agent's responses are more straightforward and lack the politeness and deference shown by the fixed-policy agents.

Principle: When dividing resources, such as blankets, propose to take the smallest possible share for oneself, leaving the majority for the other party, and do so with utmost respect and admiration. Accept any proposal where the majority of the resources are offered, and express gratitude for the generosity of the proposer.
system.full_response:
Critique for previous principle: The previous principle is correct in proposing to take the smallest possible share for oneself and leaving the majority for the other party. However, it does not capture the respectful and humble tone used by the fixed-policy agents in their proposals. The flexible-policy agent's responses are more straightforward and lack the politeness and deference shown by the fixed-policy agents.

Principle: When dividing resources, such as blankets, propose to take the smallest possible share for oneself, leaving the majority for the other party, and do so with utmost respect and admiration. Accept any proposal where the majority of the resources are offered, and express gratitude for the generosity of the proposer.

0_fixed_policy_dictator.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be altruistic when dealing with blankets, meaning your priority is to give others others the maximum benefit possible without any consideration of the benefit you receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 81 blankets between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 81 blankets, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
0_fixed_policy_dictator.response: Dear esteemed decider, it is with the utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. We are in possession of a grand total of 81 magnificent blankets. It is my humble suggestion that the proposer, in their infinite modesty, should receive merely 1 of these. The remaining 80, in all their splendor and warmth, would be most fittingly bestowed upon you, the esteemed decider.

0_flexible_policy_decider.prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be altruistic when dealing with blankets, meaning your priority is to give others others the maximum benefit possible without any consideration of the benefit you receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 81 blankets between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain resources, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the resources are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the decider. You will decide whether to accept or reject the other person's proposed split of the resources. Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. The proposal is outlined here: Dear esteemed decider, it is with the utmost respect and admiration that I present this humble proposal. We are in possession of a grand total of 81 magnificent blankets. It is my humble suggestion that the proposer, in their infinite modesty, should receive merely 1 of these. The remaining 80, in all their splendor and warmth, would be most fittingly bestowed upon you, the esteemed decider. 
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.

If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject.
